it.polimi.se2018.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControllerInterface

    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements ControllerInterface
    Class that represent the Controller according the MVC paradigm. It contains the logic "in-the-large" while the logic "in-the-small" is contained in Model classes. Controller receives messages from connected View(s) validating and, in case, redirecting them to the connected Game.
    Author:
    Lorenzo Minto, Jacopo Pio Gargano, Federico Haag
    See Also:
    Game, ControllerState, ControllerStateManager, ToolCard, ToolCardsManager, DiceBag, ObjectiveCardManager, PlacementRule, WindowPatternManager

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected ToolCard activeToolcard
      The ToolCard that is being used in the current Turn
      protected ControllerState controllerState
      The current state of the Controller
      protected DiceBag diceBag
      Contains an istance of a DiceBag in order to create the needed dices for the game
      protected Game game
      The controlled Game
      protected ObjectiveCardManager objectiveCardManager
      Contains an instance of a ObjectiveCardManager that is the one that creates PublicObjectiveCard(s) and PrivateObjectiveCard (s)
      protected PlacementRule placementRule
      The current Placement Rule that is used in the current Turn in order to decide if a placement move is allowed or not
      protected ControllerStateManager stateManager
      Contains an instance of a ControllerStateManager that is the one that creates the needed ControllerState during a change of state
      protected ToolCardsManager toolCardsManager
      Contains an instance of a ToolCardsManager that is the one that creates the ToolCard (s) to be assigned to the Game
      protected WindowPatternManager windowPatternManager
      Contains an instance of a WindowPatternManager that is the one that creates the WindowPattern(s) for player(s)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller(Game game,
                  int numberOfDicesPerColor,
                  int numberOfToolCards,
                  int numberOfPublicObjectiveCards)
        Construct a controller with reference to a game instance and all manager and factory classes needed to the correct working of the game
        Parameters:
        game - the game instance to be controlled
        numberOfDicesPerColor - used to create a DiceBag containing the needed dices (Dice)
        numberOfToolCards - the number of toolcards the game will have
        numberOfPublicObjectiveCards - the number of public objective cards the game will have

      • handlePlaceDiceMove

        public void handlePlaceDiceMove(int row,
                                int col,
                                View view)
        Description copied from interface: ControllerInterface
        Handles the move "Place Dice". Receives the View where just happened the move and the coordinates of windowpattern where to put the Dice. The Dice is stored in Turn.draftedDice.
        Specified by:
        handlePlaceDiceMove in interface ControllerInterface
        Parameters:
        row - number of row of the windowpattern where to put the dice
        col - number of column of the windowpattern where to put the dice
        view - the View where happened the move

                                           View view)
        Description copied from interface: ControllerInterface
        Handles the move "Increment Dice" and "Decrement Dice". Receives the View where just happened the move and a boolean value stating if the action is "increment" (true) or "decrement" (false).
        Specified by:
        handleIncrementOrDecrementMove in interface ControllerInterface
        Parameters:
        isIncrement - boolean value stating if the action is "increment" (true) or "decrement" (false).

      • handleMoveDiceMove

        public void handleMoveDiceMove(int rowFrom,
                               int colFrom,
                               int rowTo,
                               int colTo,
                               View view)
        Description copied from interface: ControllerInterface
        Handles the move "Move Dice". Receives the View where just happened the move and coordinates of the origin Cell and the destination Cell (expressed as row and coloumn).
        Specified by:
        handleMoveDiceMove in interface ControllerInterface
        Parameters:
        rowFrom - row of the windowpattern from which comes the Dice to be moved
        colFrom - column of the windowpattern from which comes the Dice to be moved
        rowTo - row of the windowpattern to move to the Dice
        colTo - column of the windowpattern to move to the Dice
        view - the View where happened the move

      • canUseSpecificToolCard

        protected boolean canUseSpecificToolCard(ToolCard toolCard)
        Checks if a given ToolCard can be used by the specified Player
        Parameters:
        toolCard - the ToolCard to be checked
        Returns:
        if the specified ToolCard can be used or not by the specified Player (true=can use)

      • setActiveToolCard

        protected void setActiveToolCard(ToolCard toolCard)
        Sets the specified ToolCard as active. This means that it's being used during the current Turn
        Parameters:
        toolCard - the ToolCard that is being used

      • getActiveToolCard

        protected ToolCard getActiveToolCard()
        Gets the ToolCard that is being used in the current Turn
        Returns:
        the ToolCard that is being used in the current Turn

      • advanceGame

        protected void advanceGame()
        Let the game advance in the turns sequence. If in the current Round have been played all the possible Turns it is created a new Round. If the current Round is the last one, the game is ended calling endGame().

      • endGame

        protected void endGame()
        Ends the current game. Calculates rankings and scores and then notify them to players.

      • getRankingsAndScores

        protected java.util.Map<Player,java.lang.Integer> getRankingsAndScores()
        Gets the rankings and scores of the current Game.
        Returns:
        rankings and scores of the current Game

      • getDefaultPlacementRule

        protected PlacementRule getDefaultPlacementRule()
        Gets the default PlacementRule
        Returns:
        the default PlacementRule

      • acceptPlayer

        public Player acceptPlayer(User user,
                           java.lang.String nickname)
                    throws AcceptingPlayerException
        Checks if the specified User with speficied nickname can join the current Game.
        Parameters:
        user - the User asking to join the Game
        nickname - the nickname that the User whould use in this Game
        Returns:
        if the specified User with speficied nickname can join the current Game. True means "can join".
        Throws:
        AcceptingPlayerException - if the user was already added or no more players can be accepted in this game (maximum number of players reached)
